name: Arjun Guha
content: Arjun Guha Toggle navigation Home Teaching Software Publications Service About Arjun Guha Associate Professor Northeastern University a.guha@northeastern.edu About I conduct research in programming languages. For the past few years, I have primarily been focused on (1) program synthesis for "low-resource" programming languages--these are languages that are not Python, Java, etc. but are widely used in specialized fields, such as scientific computing--and (2) understanding how computer science education is impacted by large language models. Here are three representative papers on this work: MultiPL-E: A Scalable and Extensible Approach to Benchmarking Neural Code Generation Knowledge Transfer from High-Resource to Low-Resource Programming Languages for Code LLMs How Beginning Programmers and Code LLMs (Mis)read Each Other I teach a variety of undergraduate and graduate courses. I have been the lead instructor for Northeastern's CS1 course several times, designed several new courses, and taught graduate seminars on topics as varied as Code LLM development and program verification. I also serve as the Area Chair for Software at Northeastern's Khoury College of Computer Sciences. Current Teaching Engineering LLM-Integrated Systems Recent News More Than a Score: Probing the Impact of Prompt Specificity on LLM Code Generation will appear at IJCNLP-AACL 2025 (October 2025) ReasoningWeekly: A General Knowledge and Verbal Reasoning Challenge for Large Language Models will appear at IJCNLP-AACL 2025 (October 2025) Preprint: AgentPack: A Dataset of Code Changes, Co-Authored by Agents and Humans (September 2025) Understanding How CodeLLMs (Mis)Predict Types with Activation Steering will appear at BlackboxNLP 2025 (September 2025) Preprint: Agnostics: Learning to Code in Any Programming Language via Reinforcement with a Universal Learning Environment (August 2025) Robo-Instruct will appear at COLM 2025 (July 2025) Bridging the Gap Between Binary and Source Based Package Management in Spack will appear at SC 2025 (June 2025) "I Would Have Written My Code Differently": Beginners Struggle to Understand LLM-Generated Code will appear at HumanAISE 2025 (April 2025) Substance Beats Style: Why Beginning Students Fail to Code with LLMs will appear at NAACL 2025 (January 2025) NNsight and NDIF: Democratizing Access to Open-Weight Foundation Model Internals will appear at ICLR 2025 (January 2025) Fully Transparent Self-Alignment for Code Generation will appear at NeurIPS 2024 (October 2024) Instructor-Written Hints as Automated Test Suite Quality Feedback will appear at SIGCSE 2025 (October 2024) DoE Award on AI for High-Performance Computing in the Sciences, with David Bau, Harshita Menon, William Godoy, Abhinav Bhatale, and Tom Goldstein (September 2024) Knowledge Transfer from High-Resource to Low-Resource Programming Languages for Code LLMs will appear at OOPSLA 2024 (August 2024) Can It Edit? Evaluating the Ability of Large Language Models to Follow Code Editing Instructions will appear at the Conference on Language Modelling (July 2024) Research Group I am a member of the Programming Research Laboratory at Northeastern. I work with a great group of students: Aleks Boruch⁠-⁠Gruszecki (postdoc) Zixuan Wu (PhD) Francesca Lucchetti (PhD) John Gouwar (PhD) Yangtian Zi (PhD) Alumni Abhinav Jangda (PhD → Microsoft Research) Ming-Ho Yee (PhD → Meta) James Perretta (PhD, co-advised with Jonathan Bell → University of Massachusetts Amherst) Donald Pinckney (PhD, co-advised with Jonathan Bell → Gitar) Luna Phipps-Costin (MS) Emily Herbert (MS) Samuel Baxter (MS) Rian Shambaugh (MS) Nimish Gupta (MS → Amazon) Claire Schlesinger (undergrad, NSF GRFP honorable mention) Federico Cassano (undergrad, CRA finalist → Cursor) Anders Freeman (Wellesley College undergrad → PhD student at University of Massachusetts Amherst) Sydney Nguyen (Wellesley College undergrad) Nicole Andrews (Mount Holyoke College undergrad) Jenna Hammond (Mount Holyoke College undergrad, CRA honorable mention) Sam Lee (undergrad) Christopher Rybicki (undergrad → MS student at Cornell Tech) Harsh Poddar (undergrad → Meta) Jane Tangen (undergrad → MITRE) Rachit Nigam (undergrad → PhD student at Cornell) Ariel Weiss (undergrad, NSF GRFP → PhD student at Northeastern University) Akshay Gadre (undergrad → PhD student at Carnegie Mellon) Support My research has been supported by the National Science Foundation, the Department of Energy, the Office of Naval Research, and gifts from Google, JPMorgan Chase, MathWorks, Meta, Oracle, and, Roblox.
